text: this variation on our classic quiche is
made with the puree of fresh peas and
mint so to get started I have my already
blind baked classic quiche crust it's
beautifully brown and flat and cooked
all the way through it's nice and cool
so that's good going on the filling I've
already steamed the peas I have 8 ounces
of fresh piece that I steamed with a
quarter cup of packed mint leaves
transfer that to the food processor ok
so that's everything from the steamer
now to help it get really smooth I'm
going to use some of the steaming liquid
because a lot of that flavor went into
this liquid so I don't want to lose it I
need a half a cup ok half a cup goes in
here and of course a little bit of salt
just to bring out the flavor and I'm
going to puree this until really smooth
we need six eggs just break them into
this big bowl whisk these together just
break them up get them started and then
a one and a half cups of whole milk one
and a half cups heavy cream then a
little bit more salt one and a half
teaspoons and a half teaspoon of ground
pepper this is our classic custard that
you could add just about anything too
and we're gonna add the peas and mint so
this whole puree just goes right in and
this is going to make a really not only
delicious but being quiche perfect for
spring if you have any size that have
dipped down a little bit lower than the
rest only go up with the custard as high
as you can definitely don't want this to
leak over the side okay that looks good
I think I'm gonna stop there it will
cuff up a little bit during baking this
is gonna go into a 375-degree oven for
10 minutes turn it down to 325 and bake
just until the center is set this is a
deep quiche so it is going to take about
an hour and 10 minutes longer now this
is really a showstopper quiche and it is
so tasty and so silky inside okay let's
cut into this guy you have to see how
beautiful this silky green filling is
and it it really does slice like a dream
so easy here comes whoo look at that
beautiful custard inside it's got a
great white stripe of the custard on the
bottom and the delicious pea and mint is
on top it really is as delicious as it
is beautiful it is sure to be a
showstopper at your next brunch
